author: dantraMSFT
body:
Fix https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/2860
This change considers JSON parsing errors as non-terminating errors to enable support for ErrorAction. Previously, parsing errors were reported as terminating errors.

This is a potential breaking change for code that expected a terminating error.

comments.author: joeyaiello
comments.body: @PowerShell/powershell-committee (subset of @HemantMahawar @lzybkr @khansen00 and myself) agree that the original issue (#2860) is by design. It is unreasonable for `ConvertFrom-Json` to emit anything but an error when receiving malformed input, and terminating errors are not respected by `-ErrorAction`. If a developer absolutely wants to make a conscious choice to ignore that terminating error, they should use try/catch.

title: Issue 2860 - Ignore and SIlentlyContinue ErrorActions are not honored
